page.title: 16SCHOOLS WASHINGTON
page.content: Two{primary schools}were surveyed. {St. Bedes,}opened in 1969, has 11 classrooms, a remedial room, a practical area for painting and craftwork and a nursery with a play area. {Usworth Colliery School}is 56 years old. There are 12 classes and 322 children are taught by 15 teachers. There is a library. No uniform is worn. Most children go on to{Usworth {Secondary School. A typical pupil's {day}is as follows: "I arrive at 8.30am and go to 3rd form registration which is followed by a Latin Grammar lesson. Maths begins at 9.45; then P.E. where we learn most sports including swimming. After lunch we have French translation and school closes at 3.30pm. Often we have homework."
